content.body:
# Test Your Tutor Before Going Live

Before real callers arrive, you need to know your tutor works correctly. The **Simulator** runs the full pipeline ‚Äî personality measurement, adaptation, prompt composition ‚Äî without a real phone connection.

## What you'll learn

- **Start a test conversation** ‚Äî chat with the tutor as a simulated caller
- **Observe adaptation** ‚Äî watch the tutor adjust to personality traits
- **Understand the pipeline** ‚Äî see what happens behind each message
- **Readiness checklist** ‚Äî know when the tutor is ready for real callers

## Why this matters

Launching an untested tutor risks a bad first impression. The simulator lets you catch issues before they affect real learners.

## Time: ~5 minutes

Use **‚Üê ‚Üí** arrow keys or the buttons below to navigate.

steps.title: Observe Adaptive Behavior
steps.description: As the conversation continues, notice how the tutor adapts. It adjusts warmth, formality, pacing, and teaching style based on the caller's measured traits.

left.alt: Chat showing tutor adapting its communication style

right.body:
## How Adaptation Works

Every message goes through the pipeline:

1. **MEASURE** ‚Äî Extract personality signals from the caller's words
2. **ADAPT** ‚Äî Update the caller's personality profile
3. **COMPOSE** ‚Äî Build a prompt tuned to this specific caller
4. **RESPOND** ‚Äî Generate a response that matches their style

## What to Look For

- **Warmth** ‚Äî Does the tutor match the caller's emotional tone?
- **Formality** ‚Äî Does it adjust between casual and professional?
- **Pacing** ‚Äî Does it give short answers to brief questions, and detailed answers when asked?
- **Teaching style** ‚Äî Does it use examples for kinesthetic learners, diagrams for visual learners?

The adaptation is subtle at first but becomes more pronounced after several messages.

steps.reason: Adaptive behavior is the core value proposition. If the tutor doesn't adapt, it's just a chatbot. Watching it adapt in real time proves the pipeline works.

tips.message: Try sending messages in different styles ‚Äî formal, casual, brief, detailed ‚Äî to see how the tutor adjusts

steps.title: Prompt Composition
steps.description: Behind each response, the pipeline composes a personalized prompt. The simulator can show you exactly what prompt was sent to the AI model.

left.alt: Prompt composition details showing pipeline stages

right.body:
## The Composition Pipeline

Every response is built from layers:

1. **System Context** ‚Äî domain identity, boundaries, rules
2. **Caller Profile** ‚Äî personality traits, learning style, preferences
3. **Memory** ‚Äî facts and context from previous calls
4. **Content** ‚Äî relevant teaching material at the right trust level
5. **Conversation** ‚Äî recent messages for context

## Why This Matters

The prompt isn't static. It's rebuilt for every single message, incorporating the latest personality measurements, memory updates, and content relevance.

This is why two callers get different responses to the same question ‚Äî their profiles shape the prompt differently.

## In the Simulator

Click **Pipeline Details** on any message to see the full composed prompt. This is the best way to debug unexpected tutor behavior.

steps.reason: Understanding prompt composition helps you debug issues. If the tutor says something wrong, the composed prompt shows you exactly why.

tips.message: Click Pipeline Details on any message to inspect the full prompt that was sent to the AI model

steps.title: Ready to Go Live
steps.description: You've tested the tutor and verified it works. Here's a checklist for going live, plus what to do next.

content.body:
# Ready to Go Live?

Before accepting real callers, confirm these items:

## Pre-Launch Checklist

- [ ] **Tutor responds correctly** ‚Äî answers are accurate and on-topic
- [ ] **Adaptation works** ‚Äî tutor adjusts to different communication styles
- [ ] **Personality measurement active** ‚Äî Big Five and VARK scores update
- [ ] **Content is accurate** ‚Äî assertions match your source material
- [ ] **Onboarding feels right** ‚Äî first-call experience is welcoming
- [ ] **Edge cases handled** ‚Äî off-topic questions, confusion, silence
- [ ] **Trust levels set** ‚Äî regulated content uses L4+ trust

## When the Tutor Isn't Ready

Common issues and fixes:
- **Wrong tone** ‚Äî adjust identity spec parameters (warmth, formality)
- **Inaccurate content** ‚Äî review assertions, check trust levels
- **No adaptation** ‚Äî verify PERS-001 and VARK-001 specs are active
- **Poor onboarding** ‚Äî edit onboarding flow in domain settings

## What's Next

1. **Invite real callers** ‚Äî use the invite system
2. **Monitor progress** ‚Äî track callers from day one
3. **Iterate** ‚Äî refine based on real conversations

## Related Demos

- *Create a Tutor Domain from Scratch* (DEMO-TUTOR-001)
- *Launch a Domain in Under 5 Minutes* (DEMO-QUICK-001)
- *Track a Caller's Learning Journey* (DEMO-CALLER-001)

steps.reason: Going live without a checklist risks avoidable issues. This summary ensures operators have verified everything and know what to do if something isn't right.
